text: I'm a python newbie, so maybe my question is very noob.
Assume I have a list of words, and I want to find the number of times each word appears in that list.
Obvious way to do this is:

code:
words = "apple banana apple strawberry banana lemon"
uniques = set(words.split())
freqs = [(item, words.split.count(item)) for item in uniques]
print(freqs)

text: But I find this code not very good, because this way program runs through words list twice, once to build the set, and second time counting the number of appearances.
Of course, I could write a function to run through list and do the counting, but that wouldn't be so pythonic.
So, is there a more efficient and pythonic way?
